intro: Monotoca billawinica, commonly known as the slender rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to survive in dry, harsh environments. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, helping to reduce water loss, while its flowers are usually yellow or orange, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Monotoca billawinica is often found in open habitats such as spinifex plains and gravelly slopes.
